intro: Sterculia palauensis, commonly known as the Palau mulberry, is a flowering plant native to the island of Palau in the Pacific Ocean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to the tropical island environment.
